intro: Helicteres urbani, commonly known as the urban helicteres, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
